History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient expressed satisfaction in creating new material and is preparing for an open mic performance. They experience nervousness about audience reactions but cope by reminding themselves that the audience is there to enjoy, not judge. They also feel pressure to succeed in their performances.
Psychosocial History: The patient has reached out to friends, enjoyed conversations that made them laugh, and feels more connected. They are working on setting boundaries around their work hours, which has allowed them more time to relax and enjoy shows.
Risk Assessment: The patient feels pressure to succeed and is exploring what success means to them, focusing on performing regularly and making people laugh.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reported feeling calmer after practicing breathing exercises.
Current Functional Status: The patient has started setting boundaries by shutting their laptop by 7 PM, which has improved their evenings and allowed them to relax and watch shows.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress in their creative endeavors and managing anxiety through techniques like breathing exercises.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to continue practicing breathing exercises and to nurture their creativity.
Next Steps: The patient plans to treat themselves after each performance as a way to celebrate their achievements.
